metadata.Title: CVE-2021-25635 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in LibreOffice, where it improperly validated signatures for algorithms that were not verified. This flaw leads to LibreOffice presenting a valid signature when the validity of the signature was not verified.  The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality and integrity.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-25635` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

fonts-opensymbol - 1:7.2.1-0ubuntu3
gir1.2-lokdocview-0.1 - 1:7.2.1-0ubuntu3
libjuh-java - 1:7.2.1-0ubuntu3
libjurt-java - 1:7.2.1-0ubuntu3

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This CVE is specific to the Microsoft Crypto API backend

criterions.comment: libreoffice package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:7.2.1-0ubuntu3').
